Camera System.

struct  NE_Camera

Detailed Description

Functions to manipulate cameras.

Note: Be careful. If the 'look' vector of the camera is on the same axis as the 'up' vector, projection will be incorrect. For example, if 'up' = (0,1,0), avoid looking at (0,1,0) and (0,-1,0) and very similar vectors (because of unaccuracy of math functions).

Note 2: This could use hardware accelerated ways to calculate, but I prefer this way to avoid getting an incorrect matrix and never being able to recuperate it without reseting the camera.

Note 3: This is not meant to be your game's camera system. This is just for testing levels and things like that.

void NE_CameraRotate ( NE_Camera *  cam,
int  rx,
int  ry,
int  rz 
)

Rotates a camera by global x, y and z axis on its position.

Rotates a camera by its relative x, y and z axis on its position.

Parameters:
cam Camera to be rotated.
rx Angle to rotate on the X axis (0-511).
ry Angle to rotate on the Y axis.
rz Angle to rotate on the Z axis.
cam Camera to be rotated.
rx Angle to rotate on the X axis (Up-Down) (0-511).
ry Angle to rotate on the Y axis (Right-Left).
rz Angle to rotate on the Z axis (Rotate view).

void NE_CameraSystemReset ( int  numcameras  ) 

Resets the camera system and sets the maximun number of cameras.

Parameters:
numcameras Number of cameras. If it is less than 1, it will create space for NE_DEFAULT_CAMERAS.
